name: CorruptedDAG
summary: Mining nodes will generate erroneous PoW on epochs > `385`.
description:
A mining flaw could cause miners to erroneously calculate PoW, due to an index overflow, if DAG size is exceeding the maximum 32 bit unsigned value.

This occurred on the ETC chain on 2020-11-06. This is likely to trigger for XCB mainnet around block `11550000`/epoch `385`, slated to occur early January 2021.

This issue is relevant only for miners, non-mining nodes are unaffected, since non-mining nodes use a smaller verification cache instead of a full DAG.

name: GoCrash
summary: A denial-of-service issue can be used to crash Gocore nodes during block processing, due to an underlying bug in Go (CVE-2020-28362) versions < `1.15.5`, or `<1.14.12`
description:
The DoS issue can be used to crash all Gocore nodes during block processing, the effects of which would be that a major part of the Core network went offline.

Outside of Go-Core, the issue is most likely relevant for all forks of Gocore (such as TurboGocore or ETCâ€™s core-gocore) which is built with versions of Go which contains the vulnerability.

name: ShallowCopy
summary: A consensus flaw in Gocore, related to `datacopy` precompile
description: Gocore erroneously performed a 'shallow' copy when the precompiled `datacopy` (at `0x00...04`) was invoked. An attacker could deploy a contract that uses the shallow copy to corrupt the contents of the `RETURNDATA`, thus causing a consensus failure.
